the new moon; by implication, a month
Nisan, the first month of the Jewish sacred year
a year (as a revolution of time)
Artachshasta (or Artaxerxes), a title (rather than name) of several Persian kings
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)

3.brief: properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to spoil (literally, by breaking to pieces); figuratively, to make (or be) good fornothing, i.e. bad (physically, socially or morally)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill
an opening, i.e. door or gate

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
to judge (officially or mentally); by extension, to intercede, pray
near, with or among; often in general, to
